alert.note: Alert for Humacao; Maunabo; Patillas; Yabucoa (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued November 09 at 9:12AM AST until November 09 at 12:00PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AST TODAY FOR HUMACAO, MAUNABO, PATILLAS AND YABUCOA COUNTIES... At 912 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing, particularly in Maunabo, where emergency managers reported that Rio Maunabo is out of its banks, affecting road PR-759 in Sector Tumbao of Bo Palo Seco near Puente La Garona. This road is impassable. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Yabucoa, Maunabo, Humacao, Patillas, Emajagua, Martorell, Playita, La Fermina, Palmas, Anton Ruiz, Punta Santiago, Rosa Sanchez, El Negro, Comunas, Palo Seco, Candelero Arriba, Lamboglia, Bajandas and Yaurel. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
